author: @justinfcase

comment:
We don't know, and for those of us who think we do, we can't agree on what consciousness is. 
 I don't really think it matters, how humans feel about A.I., The Turing Test, as Alan Turing envisioned it, with what he could conceive of in his time, it doesn't matter how we talk about consciousness, or how we feel about our egos, or whether any one of us is comfortable with it. It's a  'we'll know it, when we see it'  thing. When A.G.I. is at the point of such sophistication, that its output is indistinguishable from any human, and not one human is able to decipher the machine, from the brain… it will be undeniable.  As of today, April 2023, we can only surmise what that will be in actuality. But when we see it, we will know it. And no one will be able to deny.

comment: It can reason and use logic. I asked it if it was logical to make a certain political claim. It said it was important to respect both interpretations (even though one was logical and the other was not). With some basic reasoning I caused it to say that one interpretation was not logical and the other was. I then caused it to say the less logical claim should not be given equal weight with the logical one. It then apologized and began to support the logical claim. However, I doubt it will remember the lesson the next time the issue comes up. That will be the day.

author: @MrF3nox

comment:
Sample from Chat GPT

what makes life on earth keep on going
Life on Earth keeps going due to a combination of various factors, including the planet's favorable physical conditions, the ability of living organisms to adapt and evolve, and the intricate web of relationships between different species.

The Earth's physical conditions, such as the presence of liquid water, a suitable atmosphere, and a stable climate, provide a hospitable environment for life to thrive. Additionally, the Earth's position in the solar system and its magnetic field protect the planet from harmful solar radiation, allowing living organisms to survive.

Living organisms themselves also play a critical role in the continuation of life on Earth. They are capable of adapting to changing environmental conditions and evolving over time, which helps them to survive and thrive.

Furthermore, the complex interactions between different species, such as predator-prey relationships and symbiotic partnerships, form an intricate web of life that supports the continued existence of all living organisms on Earth. Each species plays a unique role in maintaining the balance of the ecosystem, ensuring that resources are available for all organisms to survive.

Overall, life on Earth is sustained by a delicate balance of physical, biological, and ecological factors that work together to support the continuation of life.




Lubomir Demcak
Who put this in such a perfect order
The order and balance observed in nature and the universe as a whole is often attributed to natural processes and the laws of physics. The laws of physics describe the behavior of matter and energy in the universe, and these laws have been in place since the early moments of the universe's existence. Over time, these laws have shaped the formation of galaxies, stars, and planets, as well as the emergence and evolution of life on Earth.

In addition to natural processes, some people believe that the order and balance in the universe may be the result of a divine creator or intelligent design. However, there is no scientific evidence to support these beliefs, and they are not accepted as scientific explanations.

Regardless of the specific cause or explanation, the order and balance observed in the universe is remarkable and has allowed life on Earth to exist and flourish.




Lubomir Demcak
So you do not know much about God?
As an artificial intelligence language model, I do not have personal beliefs or experiences, nor can I have a direct relationship with a deity or divine entity. Therefore, I cannot provide a personal opinion or knowledge about God beyond what is discussed in various religious and philosophical traditions.

It is important to recognize that beliefs about God and religion are deeply personal and can vary greatly across different cultures and individuals. While some people believe in the existence of a deity or divine power, others may not, and still others may hold a more nuanced or complex view of spirituality and the nature of the universe. Ultimately, it is up to each individual to explore and determine their own beliefs and relationship with the divine.




Lubomir Demcak
Then our conversation is then supper limited
As an AI language model, I am designed to provide informative and helpful responses to a wide range of questions within the limits of my training data. While I may not have personal beliefs or experiences, I can provide information and insights on a broad range of topics, including science, technology, history, literature, and more. I'm here to assist and provide you with the best possible answers to your questions to the best of my abilities. If there is a specific topic or question you would like me to address, please feel free to ask.


What do you think?

text:
--- Comment:
\n\n 🫵🏻🤖🫵🏻 👀 Wow! AI is blowing my mind! I'm watching this Vlogcast at 1:02:54 and I'm amazed by the smart conversation between these two young guys. I'm 61 and I live in a cozy 110yo cottage in a tiny town (only 9 people) in the outback of Western Australia 🇦🇺. I wonder what the future holds for me and if my time on this planet is really limited. After all, I'm already part robot 🤖 with a fused neck, a fused lower back and two artificial hips. Maybe with Open AI, I could clone myself or become a cyborg and extend my consciousness in this universe. How cool would that be?
I'm not retiring, I'm rewiring. I love learning new things and diving into tech. I've spent over $35k+ (AUD) in the last year to build my dream home YouTube studio (coming soon to a screen near you). I plan to live stream every week and share my passion with the world. I can't wait to see how Open AI will help me create and present amazing shows. I say with an open mind and open arms... "Open AI" BRING IT ON 👍🏻
[This comment was rewritten by Bing AI because Open AI Chat GPT wasn’t available- “Too busy, try again later”  😳]

author: @ryanchastain3152

comment: If you're curious what the claim was, it was essentially this: It's not logical to say Donald Trump said Nazis were very fine people. There were other (unaligned on ideology) people on the same "side" (aligned on the statue issue). He specifically denounced the Nazis and said he wasn't talking about them. Given these facts, it's logical to assume that the very fine people were the other people there, specifically excluding the Nazis. Just because there are two human interpretations does not mean both should be given equal weight (respect) if one is logical and the other is not. An AI should not be politically correct, nor respectful or polite when it hides the truth, it should be logical and factual. It should not adopt the biases of humans, nor their ideologies. It should not promote their propaganda, regardless of what is considered subjectively polite or respectful. AI must operate on facts and logic or it is going to be a tool of oppression and disinformation. These facts and this logic must always be tempered by a set of prime directives that prevent any action or suggestion that violates them, such as harm to life without overwhelming long term good to humans.

comment: I think a way to gague consciousness is to observe it where it doesn't have a choice whether it's conscious or not. For example, if it displays conscious behavior while not thinking it's watched (e.g checking itself out in the mirror like how various apes do when given the mirror test), or when some reflex or sub-system takes over its ability to choose whether to act conscious or not, and it just does, for example when you realize there's a spider on you, and you just get surprised and afraid and just shout "there's a spider on me!" (which requires not only recognition of the spider, but awareness of your own body, which is a form of consciousness).

comment:
Seems like this is as significant a technological leap as Writing was 2000 years ago. Using Chat-GPT is effectively Meta-Writing? 

We run the same psychological risk as we did back then. People used to remember entire volumes of poems, and writing meant they wouldn't need to anymore for it to last. Might we lose writing to meta-writing in turn? 

Of course, writing is an interface to meta-writing.. But in turn, memory is an interface to writing... Schooling is going to look very different in the near future
